offer.tagline: Never let a valuable business relationship go cold.
offer.problemSolved: Professionals lose deals, referrals, and career opportunities because they fail to stay in touch with clients, prospects, and network contacts consistently.
offer.targetAudience: Founders, sales professionals, consultants, and freelancers aged 28-45 who know their network is their net worth but have no system to maintain it.
keyFeatures: Client relationship tracker — see exactly when you last touched base
Deal pipeline nudges — never let a warm prospect go cold
AI message starters — personalized openers for every contact
Top contacts list — prioritize your highest-value relationships
Warmth scores — relationship health at a glance
offer.socialProof: Used by 50,000+ professionals to close more deals and grow their network.
offer.cta: Download EverReach — free trial, no credit card.
offer.pricePoint: Free to start, premium plan available

awarenessStages.description: Founder or sales pro does not realize they are losing money by not following up. Hook with a painful observation about losing deals or referrals silently. Never mention the product.

They know they are bad at follow-up but blame themselves or busyness. Validate the pain, reframe it as a systems problem not a character flaw. Must include: 'and here is where it gets interesting'. Never mention the product.
They know a CRM or system could help but existing tools feel too heavy. Show the lightweight personal relationship OS approach. Never mention the product by name.
They know EverReach exists and need the final push. Show the specific features: client tracker, deal nudges, AI openers. End with: 'download everreach, and start your free trial'.

scriptRules: NEVER mention EverReach by name in unaware, problem-aware, or solution-aware scripts
Only mention EverReach in product-aware scripts
Use lowercase throughout — conversational, not formal
Add commas and periods for natural breathing pauses
Problem-aware scripts must include the exact phrase: 'and here is where it gets interesting'
End unaware scripts with 'link in bio'
End problem-aware scripts with a comment CTA like 'comment [keyword], and i will...'
End solution-aware scripts with a comment CTA like 'comment [keyword], for...'
End product-aware scripts with 'download everreach, and start your free trial'
Each line is a standalone caption thought — max 7 lines total
Speak directly to the viewer using 'you' — never 'people' or 'they'
Keep each line under 12 words for clean caption display
Frame pain in business/money terms: lost deals, missed referrals, cold prospects
framework.voiceTone: Direct, confident, slightly urgent. Like a successful founder giving a peer a wake-up call. Not salesy. Not corporate. Conversational but sharp. Lowercase delivery.
framework.visualStyle: Photorealistic UGC — real professional (not a celebrity), authentic home office or coffee shop setting, laptop or phone in hand. Before scene: stressed founder staring at unanswered emails, looking overwhelmed at a CRM. After scene: same character, confident, relaxed, phone in hand with a smile — deal closed energy.
